p: In 2017, 26 279 cases were reported in total, including 15 369 (58.5%; 95% CI: 57.8%–59.0%) without warning signs, 10 624 (40.4%; 95% CI: 39.8%–41.0%) with warning signs, and 286 (1.1%; 95% CI: 0.9%–1.2%) severe dengue cases. Additionally, 57.4% (95% CI: 56.4%–57.6%) of DENV cases occurred in men. Again, DENV had a special effect on young children, with 12.5% (95% CI: 12.0%–13.1%) ​​of total DENV cases and 15.4% (95% CI: 14.9%–15.9%) of severe DENV cases reported in children under 5 years of age. Furthermore, 298 cases were reported in the indigenous population (1.1%; 95% CI: 1.0%–1.2%) and 838 in Afro-Colombians (3.2%; 95% CI: 2.9%–3.4%). There were 198 cases of infection in pregnant women (1.8%; 95% CI: 1.6%–2.3%). Of the dengue cases with warning signs, 63.7% (95% CI: 62.5%–64.5%) were hospitalized in 2017, and 21 deaths from DENV were confirmed.
